sentences.english: It won two silver and one bronze medals in Athens.
sentences.chinese: 在雅典該國獲得了兩枚銀牌和一枚銅牌。

sentences.english: But Miller disappointed many by winning only two silvers, in the giant slalom and the combined, which features one downhill run and one slalom run.
sentences.chinese: 結果，米勒只得到兩面銀牌，令許多人大失所望。

sentences.english: At the 2006 Asian Games CHAN WAI-KEI won silver in the women's windsurfing competition.
sentences.chinese: 2006年亞運，陳慧琪贏得女子滑浪風帆競賽銀牌。

sentences.english: He was simply thrilled to get a silver medal.
sentences.chinese: 他爲自己獲得銀牌感到興奮。

sentences.english: In addition, Kelvin and his team were first runners-up in the mixed 4x2000 metre competition.
sentences.chinese: 郭同學和隊員並在該盃賽的混合四人組別中取得銀牌。

sentences.english: But it may be racing China for the silver medal.
sentences.chinese: 但它可能要和中國爭銀牌了。

sentences.english: Duncan went on to win the silver medal and Leman earned the bronze.
sentences.chinese: 鄧肯繼續贏得銀牌，萊曼獲得了銅牌。

sentences.english: Host Canada took the silver and the US picked up the bronze.
sentences.chinese: 加拿大隊和美國隊分獲銀牌和銅牌。

sentences.english: Payne was delighted to have added Olympic silver to his world bronze.
sentences.chinese: 佩恩對世錦賽銅牌加奧運銀牌的成績感到非常高興。

sentences.english: Another Chinese athlete Shi Dongpeng won the silver medal with 13.67 sec.
sentences.chinese: 另一位中國選手史冬鵬以13秒67摘得銀牌。

sentences.english: Alessandra Sensini from Italy took the silver medal and Bryony Shaw from Britain claimed the bronze medal.
sentences.chinese: 意大利森西尼獲得了銀牌，英國的肖獲得了銅牌。

sentences.english: He won a silver trophy for shooting.
Hong won the silver at the 2007 world championships.
sentences.chinese: 在2007年的世錦賽中，洪淑貞贏得了銀牌。

sentences.english: The rest of the field was left to jockey for the silver and bronze medal positions.
sentences.chinese: 其餘的外地左騎師的銀牌和銅牌的立場。

sentences.english: It's also important to win silver and bronze medals.
sentences.chinese: 贏得銀牌和銅牌也非常重要。

sentences.english: The silver medals are almost entirely made of silver.
sentences.chinese: 銀牌則幾乎全由銀打造的。

definition: bronze medal/bronze plaque bearing a business name or logo etc/CL:枚[mei2]
special glory/distinction/rare honor/one's laurels/it's a privilege (to meet you)
